文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_034_chunk1
证据片段: Highest nodular corrosion was found with materials never β-quenched during their fabrication, whereas β-quenched materials generally showed an improved behavior.

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_034_chunk1
证据片段: In the cold-worked condition, nodular corrosion in general was less pronounced.

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_034_chunk1
证据片段: However, with respect to the in-reactor performance, no marked difference was found between stress-relieved and fully recrystallized cladding tubes.

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_034_chunk2
证据片段: nodular corrosion can be simulated in high-pressure steam tests (HPST) in the temperature range 400 to 550°C, at system pressures ≥70 bar

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_034_chunk2
证据片段: nodular corrosion can be simulated in high-pressure steam tests (HPST) in the temperature range 400 to 550°C, at system pressures ≥70 bar

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_034_chunk2
证据片段: The tests used for this study were conducted at a pressure of 125 bar and a temperature of 500°C

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_034_chunk2
证据片段: Holding time at temperature was 16 h

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_034_chunk2
证据片段: Uniform corrosion corresponds under the conditions chosen in this report to a weight gain of about 60 mg/dm²

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_034_chunk2
证据片段: Most of the fuel rod data are from cladding tubes which were stress-relief annealed (SR) after their final cold working by tube pilgering

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_034_chunk3
证据片段: Figure 6 presents a plot of in-reactor corrosion results versus the volumetric mean particle size; a pronounced correlation is shown. Zircaloy-2 and Zircaloy-4 behave quite comparably.

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_034_chunk3
证据片段: Coarsening of the intermetallic precipitates is probably due to high temperatures during some process steps after the final β-quenching process (or due to an inadequate quenching process).

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_034_chunk3
证据片段: In one series, Zircaloy-2 samples were annealed for 20 s at temperatures between 800 and 1200°C and quenched at a rate of 100 K/s.

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_034_chunk3
证据片段: In one series, Zircaloy-2 samples were annealed for 20 s at temperatures between 800 and 1200°C and quenched at a rate of 100 K/s.

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_034_chunk3
证据片段: In a second series, Zircaloy-4 samples were quenched from 870, 1050, and 1150°C at rates of 500 and 5 K/s

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_034_chunk3
证据片段: the material becomes immune to nodular corrosion only if it is annealed in (or very close to) the β-phase range before quenching

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_034_chunk3
证据片段: Quenching after annealing in the lower (α+β)-phase range (800 to 900°C) results in high sensitivity to nodular corrosion, especially if the quenching rate is high

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_034_chunk3
证据片段: samples from six Zircaloy-4 and four Zircaloy-2 lots were annealed for 10 s at 1050 or 1150°C and cooled at different controlled rates of between 0.3 and 500 K/s

证据片段: duplicate samples to those discussed in the previous section were treated for 8 h at 750°C

证据片段: Zircaloy-2 cold-worked and stress-relief annealed, in general, does not show nodular corrosion in the HPST

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_034_chunk3
证据片段: material which have seen high process temperatures after β-quenching) reach their highest nodular corrosion just when the material becomes fully recrystallized at 580°C

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_034_chunk3
证据片段: The samples from the "insensitive lots" keep their superior behavior at least up to temperatures of 600°C

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_034_chunk5
证据片段: Among the tubes tested in this program those with the best nodular corrosion resistance in the high-pressure steam test had the worst behavior using ASTM Practice for Aqueous Corrosion Testing of Samples of Zirconium and Zirconium Alloys (G 2).

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_034_chunk5
证据片段: It was found that a high cooling rate from the beta or alpha-plus-beta range is the best way to achieve products with good nodular corrosion resistance in a high-pressure steam test
工艺步骤: cooling from beta or alpha-plus-beta range

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_034_chunk5
证据片段: subsequent hot working, and alpha annealing after cold rolling, led to a decrease in the nodular corrosion resistance
工艺步骤: hot working, alpha annealing after cold rolling

文献ID: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_034_chunk5
证据片段: To obtain the best nodular corrosion resistance, the final product should be quenched from the beta (or alpha-plus-beta) range, but these structures may be detrimental for the other properties.
工艺步骤: quenching from beta or alpha-plus-beta range
